resources.string:
History
Ada Lovelace, whose notes added to the end of Luigi Menabrea\'s paper included the first algorithm designed for processing by an Analytical Engine. She is often recognized as history\'s first computer programmer. See also: Computer program § History, Programmer § History, and History of programming languages Programmable devices have existed for centuries. As early as the 9th century, a programmable music sequencer was invented by the Persian Banu Musa brothers, who described an automated mechanical flute player in the Book of Ingenious Devices.[4][5] In 1206, the Arab engineer Al-Jazari invented a programmable drum machine where a musical mechanical automaton could be made to play different rhythms and drum patterns, via pegs and cams.[6][7] In 1801, the Jacquard loom could produce entirely different weaves by changing the "program" – a series of pasteboard cards with holes punched in them.
